qas.question: What king unified the Anglo-Saxon realms in England?
What treatise was written by Pope Gregory?
When did Alfred the Great's reign begin?
In what century did Alfred unify Anglo-Saxon England?
What dialect did Alfred's government use?
Who unified the Anglo-Saxon kingdoms in the 900's?
Who advocated making Latin the language of education?
What treatise did Pope Gregory I have translated into English?
What Anglo-Saxon king died in the 9th century?

context: With the unification of the Anglo-Saxon kingdoms (outside the Danelaw) by <a0_0><b5_0><b6_0>Alfred the Great<b6_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/> in the later <a3_0>9th<a3_0/> century, the language of government and literature became standardised around the <a4_0>West Saxon<a4_0/> dialect (Early West Saxon). Alfred advocated education in English alongside Latin, and had many works translated into the English language; some of them, such as Pope Gregory I's treatise <a1_0><b7_0>Pastoral Care<b7_0/><a1_0/>, appear to have been translated by Alfred himself. In Old English, typical of the development of literature, poetry arose before prose, but <b8_0>King Alfred the Great<b8_0/> (<a2_0>871<a2_0/> to 901) chiefly inspired the growth of prose.
